name: The Commonlands
description: This battle-scarred savanna is home to the City of Freeport, the Wailing Caves and Fallen Gate.

npcs.name: Aether Racing Referee
utterances: Hi there! Want to help me test my new Cognatically Reinforced Aetheric Sprocket Hoverpad? It can fly!
Alright! Get to the start platform and I'll equip you with the machine shortly. Try to beat the other test dumm-, err, test pilots around the track!

npcs.name: Amoora
utterances: Every day is the same, now that he's gone.
How did you know? Do you know him? Is he here? Father will kill him if he is!
How sweet of him. There is just no talking sense into my father, Jaharin. He will hear nothing of our love. I am afraid I have been forbidden to see Ferink.
It's you! Thank you so much!  Fenrik and I are to be wed in the spring!
...sigh... Hello there... You remind me of him, somehow...

npcs.name: Amulius Ramio
utterances: Quiet you!  Can't you see I'm trying to avoid being seen?  Get down here before an orc spots you!
Get down and wait a moment, I think I hear an orc passing.

Alright listen, the Overlord passed down orders to have me find out where these orcs have been staging their attacks from.  As you can see, this looks like an orc forward base if I ever saw one.  I don't have time to get back to Freeport to get some extra troops, so I'm going to have to ask for your help on this.  What say you?

I'm really not supposed to share this information with you, but I have no choice since I can't get help from the city.  It's like this; the orcs have been assaulting Freeport for quite sometime now and the Overlord wants to strike the enemy hard and fast, so he's come up with a plan to assassinate their field commander, Overseer Maulic.  The orders state that the scouts say he should be lightly guarded and vulnerable to an assassination attempt.  That's where you come in.

Excellent.  You are going to need to gather several able bodied adventurers, eighteen or so if I was to venture a guess.  I can't be too sure though, I know that some of you adventurer types wield some pretty powerful magic.  If you are ready, I'll give you this makeshift key I fabricated out of scrap orc weapons - this should get you past that door once the guards have been cleared.

Okay, here you go.  I'll make for Freeport as soon as you head in and pass the word that you've begun the assassination attempt.  During the confusion of Maulic's assassination, we'll press the attack from the Freeport gates crushing these foul creatures in the name of the Overlord!
What's the hold up?  Get in there and take care of Maulic, I can't do it alone.

npcs.name: an apprentice of the Dismal Rage
Arconicus
utterances: What do you want? Please don't tell me you're another one of these country bumpkins who has never seen a mage before.
Yes, these will do the job. As promised, here is your payment. Now if you don't mind, I need to start working on these growth potions and you're distracting me. Good bye.

I am conducting research on the qualities of certain natural reagents in the surrounding area. Perhaps you  can help me? If you help gather some of these resources, then I might be able to pay you for your time, hmm?

I am currently gathering the remains of what is left once a wisp is destroyed. It's difficult to see it at first, but if you know what to look for, you'll see it everytime. Once a wisp is killed, all that's left is very fine dust, and not much of it either. I need you to gather me a half-vial of wisp dust. Once you have it, bring it back and I'll pay you for it.
Let me see it... yes, this is exactly what I needed. Here is your payment. If you're still interested, I am in need of other ingredients as well. Shall we continue doing business?

It has come to my attention that I've run out of the standard catalyst I use in order to process the magical properties of this wisp dust. All I need is a small little piece of flesh found within the skull of a sentient creature. Fortunately, there are a number of zombies near the graveyard that  have these 'glands'. Gather me some of these 'glands' and I will pay you for your time.

npcs.name: Arnisu Tobian
utterances: Go away!
Ah, I see. Well, take this envelope then. It has what Tecera needs. Tell her I don't plan on staying much longer and I will see her soon.
They're experimenting with necromancy, in a way.
Well, I don't think they're just looking to reanimate corpses or control spirits. I think they're looking into actual resurrection, though they are going about it the wrong way.
I honestly don't know. Please, take this information to Tecera.

npcs.name: Assistant D'Verin
utterances: How did you make it past the servants?!  Please don't tell me that I'll have to raise them all again.

They spoke with you?! They refuse to answer a single question I put to them!  Hah!  Well, out with it! What did they tell you?  Head to the south and head to the west, and you will find the finger pointing to where the tower exists.  Or perhaps, where it doesn't...
Hahaha! Fool! You're standing in it! This is Zarvonn's tower!  But I think you really want to know about Zarvonn himself. Am I right?

If I did, I wouldn't be the servant to that witch upstairs. She's convinced that Zarvonn is still around here somewhere. I assist her in return for the necromantic magic she sparingly doles out to me. Now, tell me, did the nomads tell you where to find him?

What? I have no idea what that means! Wait ... Siege. There are orcish skeletons around the old siege ruins. My mistress claims that she didn't raise them. It must be Zarvonn! That hag was saying that Zarvonn raised them!

Who knows? Let's find out. If you go to the ruins, and bring back some bones from the odder-looking skeletons, I can find out if there's any trace of Zarvonn's magic left within them. If you do this, I'll tell the Mistress you wish to speak with her. She may tell you more about Zarvonn, though she'll probably do it a little bit at a time, over many months, while you run around doing chores for her.

Travel to the east until you reach the ruins of the orcs most successful attempt at besieging Freeport. I'll need skulls from the more powerful undead you'll find there, and make sure the skulls aren't damaged.

npcs.name: a Blackshield assassin
utterances: To arms!
Prepare to face your doom, meddler.
Cover me while we regroup!
Summon help!  We have invaders!
All hands retreat!

npcs.name: a Blackshield brute
utterances: Prepare to face your doom, meddler.
All hands retreat!
Cover me while we regroup!
You must flee!  I'll try to hold them.

npcs.name: a Blackshield dockhand
utterances: This a calm seas kind'a deal.  You don't ask questions about it.
I can.  I got gold for ale and beddin'.  That's all I care for.
Finally.  Come 'ere courier, and take this message to the rendezvous.
Should be.  Now see to it this message gets to the rendezvous at Pride Lake, and be quick about it!
You unloaded that quick.  Good job.
I don't.  I like the profit that lines the Blackshield coffers.

npcs.name: a Blackshield dock officer
utterances: We've got prices you can't beat. What can I do for you today?
... ah... Grah Grobar, is it?
No... but you do carry his receipt.
I uh... well, very well. You have the receipt, the shipment is yours. Go ahead and grab it. It's on the docks, right over there.

npcs.name: a Blackshield recruit
utterances: Nice set ups, though don't yous think?
I knows, but I can't help to wonders who the client is.
Yous don't ever wond... Hey, there ya are.
Betters get there faster then yous got here!
Thanks you!  Is find it odd to unpack goods and repack thems to be sold, though.
Profits is always good.  Such contracts to get rid of sellable goods is nices.

npcs.name: a Blackshield smuggler
utterances: Cover me while we regroup!
All hands retreat!

npcs.name: a Blackshield thug
utterances: Summon help!  We have invaders!
Prepare to face your doom, meddler.
Cover me while we regroup!

npcs.name: a Bloodskull mason
utterances: Time to meet your end, intruder.

npcs.name: a Bloodskull mystic
utterances: Sound the alarm. Destroy all trespassers!

npcs.name: a Bloodskull orc
utterances: Intruders! Destroy them all!
Back fools, there are too many!
Welcome to your death, lesser being!
Retreat! We are undone!

npcs.name: a Bloodskull priest
utterances: Time to meet your end, intruder.
You should have left when you had a chance.
Fall back and get us a shaman!
Sound the alarm. Destroy all trespassers!
I cannot hold them much longer.
There are too many!  We must regroup.

npcs.name: a Bloodskull shaman
utterances: Retreat! We are undone!
Intruders! Destroy them all!
Back fools, there are too many!

npcs.name: a Bloodskull soldier
utterances: Sound the alarm. Destroy all trespassers!
You should have left when you had a chance.

npcs.name: a Bloodskull tamer
utterances: There are too many!  We must regroup.

npcs.name: a Bloodskull tower guard
utterances: They spotted us! Kill the witnesses!
Back fools, there are too many!

npcs.name: a Bloodskull warrior
utterances: Intruders! Destroy them all!
Back fools, there are too many!
They spotted us! Kill the witnesses!
Retreat! We are undone!
I cannot hold them much longer.
There are too many!  We must regroup.
I will hold them.  Fall back and get us help!
Fall back and get us a shaman!
You should have left when you had a chance.
Welcome to your death, lesser being!
Time to meet your end, intruder.
Sound the alarm. Destroy all trespassers!

npcs.name: Brandus Levine
utterances: Hrmmm... You do have the look of a citizen about you.  You're not just random rabble from the streets.  I could use your help.
You do realize I can find someone else.  And maybe you'll just fade into obscurity.  But, since you've at least shown some interest then perhaps I can use you.

I've been waiting on a very special shipment to arrive.  It was due here three days ago and there has been no sign of the individuals who were supposed to bring it.  I've had to send the boat to the Freeport docks and every day it sits there it's costing me money.  I need you to find out what happened to my shipment or why they are so late.
That little bit of information you don't need to know.  All I'm asking for is that you find my missing cargo.

Fine, if I have to hold your hand through everything.  You might start with Nethet near the main gates of Freeport.  He watches most of who enter or leave the city.  If anyone knows anything about where my missing cargo went it would likely be him.
Watch your coin around his type.
What did Nethet tell you?  That rat had better have known something or I'm back where I started.  That will not make me a happy man.
Don't tell me your whining stories about what other people had you do.  He could have made you shovel pig dung for all I care, did you get the information or not?
The dervishes stole it!?  You can't be serious.  Argh!!  I'm tired of those lowlifes messing with my business.  I need you to do me a favor and kill a few dozen of them.

That's exactly what I wanted to hear.  Once you've thinned out the number of the dervishes for me I have a feeling they might be willing to negotiate a deal afterwards.  I want them to learn a lesson in fouling my business.  You can find one of the larger encampments on the far Western end of the Commonlands.
You'll be back when THEY'RE done, heh.

That was faster than I expected, you're quite the dangerous one aren't you?  Well done, I applaud you and your efforts in our partnership here.  Keep it up and we might get very rich together.  Tell me, how many did you get rid of before coming back?
I understand what you mean perfectly.  Here is the first of your profits, if you keep doing such excellent work there is a lot more where this came from.
Shall we continue our business venture, partner?
Good.  The dervishes are still not willing to negotiate.  I'm guessing they have either become more foolish than normal or they no longer have my shipment.

Yes, but I have another source that we might be able to use to our advantage.  Another militia guard by the name of Captain Vertas is stationed out in the Crossroads.  He has no love for the dervishes and keeps a close eye on them.
Hrm, you have?  Then what can you tell me about the dervishes that you learned from him?
Yes, see what information he has on the dervishes and what we might be able to use.
He may have some other work for you while I try to find my sorcerer partner.
Have you spoken with captain Vertas?

The Deathfist?  You cannot be serious.  Bah!  That's probably where my shipment went, there's no way I'm getting that back by now.  The orcs also have to pay for this, they had to know that shipment was mine.  Do you mind playing enforcer again?

Good, then I need you to find out what the connection is with with dervishes and the orcs.  If you watch carefully you can sometimes see orc runners near the encampments in the Southern part of the Commonlands.  I want the information they might be carrying.  Let me know what you find.
It's good to see you again.  What did you learn from the orcs?
Hrmmm.  So they are having a meeting are they?  Let me look into this and verify it isn't a trap.  Come back when you're ready to crash their meeting.
Ah yes, your reward.  Here it is.  Remember that I have more work and more rewards when you return.
Good, good, I like to see such eagerness in a citizen of Freeport.

npcs.name: a brittle skeleton
utterances: As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!
You cannot eliminate us!
That pile of bones was my friend!

npcs.name: a calcified skeleton
utterances: Your blood calls to me.
Final death comes at last.
Seek death and it finds you.
Your eyes are so pretty.
You've shaken the dust from my bones.
Rest in peace.

npcs.name: Cannix Silverflame
utterances: Greetings to you as well, traveler.  Now if you'll excuse me, I must remain vigilant while this time is appointed unto me.
A guard? No. I suppose if I have a title, you can call me a ... a pilgrim.  Yes, just a pilgrim looking for the light of truth.  Aren't we all seeking a little truth in these turbulent times?

No, I'm sorry.  I'm not interested in any local treasures ... wait ... let me see that lightstone.  You're right! This isn't like the other lightstones in these lands.  In fact, I've never seen one like it. Could it be?  Is it beginning?  It's possible, but I must be sure. Will you do something for me?

Good, good.  You didn't come upon this item by chance. You must be the one to set out on this quest. Seek out both the Mourned and the Forgotten.  One has fallen among brethren, the other alone. Both were valorous on the field of battle. Touch this stone to them and honor both.
The stone you have is glowing again.  This proves the lightstone you have is very unique.  I can show you how to increase its power.

Listen carefully:  The lion has always been a symbol of valor on the battlefield, never retreating from a foe, always protecting his charges. The great beast Rama'nai walks these lands at the head of his pride.  Slay him in honorable combat and dip the stone in his blood.  Return to me when you're done.

I see you did as you were told. The stone continues to glow brighter.  To increase its power, you must right some wrongs.  Find the orc captains Gaer and Ogof.  They routinely direct their troops to destroy and rob the graves of the ancient Knights of Truth. You must avenge this defilement of the graves; doing so will increase the power of your stone.

Excellent.  Greedy orc scavengers will no longer disturb the buried dead. Your stone grows brighter with each deed done in valor.  There is another soul in these lands who needs releasing from the eternal torment that chains him to this realm.  Will you free him?

Long ago the Priests of Marr and the Knights of Truth administered to the people of these lands.  The current ruler of Freeport despised these people and managed to kill most of them long before the Shattering. The High Priest at the time was first cursed, then executed and then his corpse was tossed out in these lands for the scavengers to feast on.  His soul hasn't found deserved rest for centuries.

Yes, you now bear an object that hasn't been seen on Norrath for centuries.  You hold the essence of the Greater Lightstone.  Defeat the cursed High Priest in battle while the lightstone is in his presence.  The powers of Valor and Truth imbued within will free him from his curse.
Your lightstone glows brilliantly!  Your quest is almost over.  I must ask you to complete a final task. If you do this, I can fully imbue your lightstone.

The elite among the Knights of Truth wielded the magical Swords of Truth. These weapons have been lost for many decades.  News has surfaced that an orc holds the hilt and broken edge of one of these lost blades; you must retrieve its remnants. With these ancient saber pieces I shall complete your Greater Lightstone.

He's a leader among the Bloodskull clan of orcs.  Rumors state his camp lies in a hidden valley close to here.  Unfortunately, I don't know the location of the camp.  You must help me get this sword back into the proper hands; it's sacrilege for such a creature to possess it.
I hoped when we met again you would bear the sword the orc leader possesses.  Please, recover the sword from that creature.
You did it!  Now hand me the broken sword and your lightstone, and I will completely empower the stone.

There!  The Great Lightstone is fully empowered with the essence of Valor, Truth, and Light!  I am truly sorry to have deceived you into thinking you could keep this stone. You must understand, it must stay with my Order. He's returning soon and we must preserve his artifacts to hasten his arrival.  It has truly pained me to speak untruthfully to you. I hope you understand the importance of this matter.
You've been exceptionally brave and valorous in this quest.  If it weren't for the dire need of my order to possess this stone, I'd gladly hand it over to you.  You must understand ... what was that?
Look alive! We have visitors!

npcs.name: Captain Feralis
utterances: Yes?
Of course. Rainus mentioned you. Somehow I guessed you would be bigger. No matter. Thank you for acting courier, that will be all.
Oh... so that's your angle. I know your type. I got enough of you in the city before I was transferred out here. Still, I suppose you serve a purpose. Sure, I've got something you can do.

Head down to that small ratonga and kerran community south west of here and collect their taxes. You'll need to collect from every house owner. Normally they place the money in their mailbox, on the front of their houses. Sometimes they forget... when that happens you remind them, understood?
Good. I've had too many softies under my watch. Here's a list of their names and how much they owe. I'll be here when you're done.
Well?
Nice work, here's your cut. While you were out another job came up, interested?

Yeah, that's what I thought. Ventar T'Kal is a man of mine. You can find him north west of here, in the company of nomads. I need you to deliver these Bloodskull Frenzy Root samples to him. They've already been treated... so don't eat them.
Good. And thanks.
Gee, were you stuck under a house or something?

I don't care about Ventar and I don't have time to be angry with you. Tecera Valnos has been working from the outpost south of the Ruins of Val'marr. Originally I had planned on her helping deal with the orcs, but as of late she has had her hands full. I need you to report to her and give her whatever assistance you can.
It might be quickest to take the griffin down from the Freeport Station.
Tecera sent word. I am very pleased with your work, <player name>. You've been a great asset, right when we needed it, too. The Overlord will be glad to hear it as well.
Better than you know. Please, take this, the city of Freeport thanks you.
No, thank you.
Good work. The Overlord will hear of you.
Orcs, Undead... I'm more worried about what the Dervish Cutthroats are up to.

npcs.name: Captain Gaer
utterances: Here comes dinner.

npcs.name: Captain Garglass
utterances: You made your final mistake.
It's only a minor setback.
There can be no end to us.

npcs.name: Captain Ista
utterances: Glad you could make it. Now how about doing a little something for Freeport?
Freeport needs you to follow the trail of slime outside of the Sewer System to the north of here. You will need to slay the oversized sliding lump of refuse known as the Gobbler.
Of course you do... that's the same thing the last group of adventurers said and look here, I still need to get this job done. Hurry along now, Freeport does not like to wait.
You can leave me alone now...

npcs.name: Captain Ogof
utterances: Looks like we have visitors!

npcs.name: Captain Vertas
utterances: Hail. What have you to report?
I knew it! Excellent work, soldier. You have earned your first insignia. If you keep up the good work, you just might make something of yourself.
Oh good, you've returned. Thank you for the information you have gathered. You seem trustworthy, but you will now need to prove your worth to the Militia and to the Overlord of Freeport.
Yes, it is time you prove your worth to me... err... to Freeport and to the Overlord. Stop asking so many questions! I have a special mission for you.

Good to hear. That is the attitude we want to see in young recruits. I need you to travel back to the camp to the west. There you will need to remove some of the dervishes from the land of the living.
Let me give you a list. Make sure to crush them thoroughly. Dervish heretics, outlanders, cutthroats, and thaumaturges. Go now! Hurry back.
You had better.
Pah, the orcs and the dervish... Listen, the Freeport Militia requires your help. Will you do a service for the Militia?
Pay... PAY? You insolent pig, you should be bowing down at my feet asking me for forgiveness. You ought to  be paying homage to the Overlord for all he has given you!

You will be compensated for your time. There have been reports of a growing threat in the Commonlands. The militia requires you to travel to the west to the road beyond the druid ring to find the orc emissary.   Our reports tell us the emissary is the one who is passing stolen information to the Deathfist Empire.
Deal with him by any means necessary! Bring back to me any evidence you may find.
I know you will. Return to me immediately once this is complete.
Note? Indeed, this is interesting. You were right to bring this to me. Well done, soldier.
This note you brought me provided us with some good information. Did you show it to anyone else?

Good. Very good to hear. Careful, kid, the dervishes have spies everywhere. Whatever you do, do not trust anyone because they might be a spy. Just last week, we had to put two people to death because we suspected them of being spies. Are you sure you're not a spy?

I guess not. You don't look like a spy. A spy wouldn't look so foolish. I need you to go scout out the dervish camps in the southwest area of The Commonlands. The note says they've set up camp in that area. Go there now and investigate it.
Bring back any information you may find. Why are you still here?
Really? Well, you may not be as useless as I first thought.
For one so young, you have done well thus far. I still have more for you to do before I can let you go. Are you up to some undercover work?
I like you, kid. What I need you to do is travel to their forward command camp and infiltrate their defenses. You will take this set of orders and switch them for their current list of orders.
Oh, sorry sport. Will you take this mission or not? It will be dangerous. Something I'm sure is right up your alley.  If it's not, well... we'll have to send the medics, I guess.
Great, hurry back! And try to come back in one piece.
Very well done. Impressive, in fact. You have earned another rank on your insignia.
You've done well up to this point, cadet. The information you have gathered so far has helped our cause. Now it's time I give you a real mission.

You are now required to perform an important task for the Militia. Because of the fake orders you delivered, we were able to pinpoint the highest ranking officer in this regiment. Now, you must go and eliminate him.

Shh...  Not so loud! I'll whisper it to you.  This type of information we do not speak in open areas. You never know who is listening. One spy hearing the wrong bit of information can ruin just about everything.
May your path be silent, and your blade be true.
I knew you had it in you, soldier. You have earned my highest respect. Take this insignia and wear it proudly as a symbol of your bravery as a member of the Militia.
Hail, good to see you again soldier!

npcs.name: Commander Du'Nar
utterances: His death means little.

npcs.name: Commander Grik'Sna
utterances: Back fools, there are too many!
Ungh!  Not fall!
Death of the weak not important.
They spotted us! Kill the witnesses!

npcs.name: Commander Ralio
utterances: All hands retreat!
Cover me while we regroup!

npcs.name: Dalar R'taan
utterances: Finding Odus should bring a wealth of new research and knowledge.

npcs.name: Darathar
utterances: This is how the fight begins! Keep going, let me be inspired by your heroism!
And so your weapons have scarred me, keep fighting, let me see your inspiration!
You can do it, show me the heroes you are!

npcs.name: a dearly departed
utterances: My love... I... am... coming...

npcs.name: a Dervish assassin
utterances: Your only chance is to run!
You think that's going to stop me?
I've been looking forward to this for hours.
Everyone fall back and meet at the hideout!
I can hold them, and I'll take some of them with me!
I was going to let you live, but now I want you to suffer!
Tear them apart!
Ready ... now!
Away!  Get away from our weapons!
Die!

npcs.name: a Dervish craftsman
utterances: I only do business with Dervs. Go away!
Who would ever think that a Smithson would end up being an anvil pounder to the bandits.
This is Dervish territory. Leave while you still can.

npcs.name: a Dervish heretic
utterances: The Highwayman will hear of this, mark my words!
There is no escape! Surrender and I'll kill you quickly!
Fall back. We can let this band go!
Attack!
You fell into our trap rather nicely.
Don't touch what doesn't belong to you!

npcs.name: a Dervish ruffian
utterances: I can hold them, and I'll take some of them with me!
Ready ... now!
I was going to let you live, but now I want you to suffer!
Everyone fall back and meet at the hideout!
Your only chance is to run!

npcs.name: a Dervish thaumaturge
utterances: They'll kill us all!
They're after us. We must kill them!
Don't let them hit me!
I don't have time for this nonsense!
Here, I'll lead the charge!
Not the head! Not the head!
Somebody find a way to get us out of here!
Away!  Get away from our weapons!
What now? More distractions? Great!
Don't touch what doesn't belong to you!

npcs.name: a Dervish thug
utterances: Someone get some help, fast!
Fall back before we're all killed!
Welcome to the party!
Make sure they die quietly!
I need help over here!
There they are! Get them!
Don't touch what doesn't belong to you!
Away!  Get away from our weapons!
Die!

npcs.name: a Dervish zealot
utterances: Fall back!  We'll meet again.
Everyone makes one mistake. That one was your last.
The iksar fear nothing!
You wanted my attention?  Now you have it!
Now, prepare to face an eternity of fear.
Welcome to a lifetime of slavery.
Welcome to the party!
Someone get some help, fast!

npcs.name: Diana Heartstrings
utterances: I greet you, great adventurer!  Isn't it wonderful!?
Our lost goddess of love has returned to us!  I was heartbroken by the news of her demise, but now that she has returned, love and compassion can take a grander hold upon us all.
Isn't it wondrous?  Love has proven that it cannot be conquered by death!  I feel like celebrating.  Don't you?

I was thinking that we could perform some grand miracles of love in Norrath.  The resulting emotions will then be released -emotions, like love and compassion, giving glory and strengthening our Lady of Love.  Would you like to help me perform these miracles of love?
Delightful!  I know of several in town that could truly benefit from the glow of love within their lives, and others that have come to me looking for help finding that special someone.
Isn't it exciting!?  I'll give you the names of the townsfolk that you should speak to.  Talk with them a while and find out who would be best coupled together, based upon what they say.
Have you spoken to each of the townsfolk, <player name>?

Ah, this is turning out to be a particularly splendid Erollisi Day!  Now that you know a bit about each person, you can help me match them up!  I have already narrowed down some of the matches, but I needed your help for the final step.
Who should Zak be matched up with?
Who would be best for Tyluna?
Who should Amund be with?
Who would Marjorie be happiest with?
Let me meditate on your choices a while, <player name>.  We do not want to be steered wrong in this!  Speak to me again, in a moment.
I feel harmony within your choices!  The love we have helped to blossom this day is a miracle performed in the name of Erollisi Marr.  Bless us upon this humble world, Holy Goddess.

You know, if you are interested, there may be more work for one as dedicated to love, as you.  I would suggest you venture to New Halas in Frostfang Sea and speak with Priest Swornlove.  He is there with the sisterhood of Erollisi.

npcs.name: a dregs sneak
utterances: Startle us, you did. We'll have to remedy that.

npcs.name: Durio Caepio
utterances: Nice to have a healer here.

npcs.name: Engineer Klaaska
utterances: I am terribly busy! Terribly busy!  Come later when I have time to talk!
Quick, then, or the winged ones will roast me alive for sure.  What is your question?
An expression, merely an expression we use.  Rich ones who are providing us funding for our venture.  Look around you, are there room for wings here? No! Naturally not.
I thought you had but one question!  I am too busy to talk.  Terribly busy!

npcs.name: Entui
utterances: The rats across the river annoy my neighbors to no end, but I think they're kind of cute.
The fishing here isn't as good as I would have hoped.
This is my house, you should remember that.

npcs.name: Executioner Selindi
utterances: Move along unless you want to join these skeletons.

npcs.name: a fallen apostle
utterances: Your presence enrages me!
Now you too are lost!
You inflict damage not pain!
Death is nothing new to us!

npcs.name: a fallen champion
utterances: Your eyes are so pretty.
Seek death and it finds you.
Final death comes at last.

npcs.name: a fallen crusader
utterances: Now you too are lost!
You can only do so much damage!
You shouldn't be here!
Your presence enrages me!
Death is nothing new to us!
It takes more than death to stop the undead.
It takes more than Death to stop the undead.

npcs.name: a fallen defender
utterances: You inflict damage not pain!
Now you too are lost!
You can only do so much damage!
Your presence enrages me!

npcs.name: a fallen diplomat
utterances: Your presence enrages me!
It takes more than Death to stop the undead.

npcs.name: a fallen disciple
utterances: Your presence enrages me!
Death is nothing new to us!

npcs.name: a fallen guardian
utterances: Now you too are lost!
It takes more than Death to stop the undead.
Death is nothing new to us!

npcs.name: a fallen orc
utterances: Take cover!
Reinforcements!

npcs.name: a fallen orc lieutenant
utterances: Take cover!
Reinforcements!

npcs.name: a farmer
utterances: Fall back in formation, and regroup at the rendezvous.
Cover me while we regroup!
All hands retreat!
Keep up the assault, no matter what the cost in lives!

npcs.name: Ferink
utterances: Oh whys oh whys can't we be together?  Oh whys oh whys. My true love, the loves of my life is locked away on the other sides of the river and I can't be with her. Oh whys does it has to be this ways? It's not fair, not fair at all. Something must be done!

Amoora, my love. She is the love of my life, the shining beacon of my heart, my passion, my preciouses Amoora has my heart and holds it captive. I aches so when I can't be nears her, when I can't smell her sweet smelling fur.

Oh, just because I'm a ratonga doesn't means I can't be with the loves of my life. No, it does not! This is just not right! I should go to her now! But I can't;  her parents don't like me. I don't know why... I'm a nice person, right?  Oh, my Amoora.
Go to her! Tell her I loves her! Tell her I'll give anything to be with her! Tell her...  just tell her I loves her for me.  My Amoora.
My Amoora...
Sob!... Sniffle! ...
She was?  Oh my Amoora! I am lost without her.
I must gets her back! Did you see her? Did you... did you tell her I loves her?  Did you? Answer me!
How was she? What did she say to you? You must tells me. You see why I loves her so... her voice, her beauty, even the day seems brighter when she's nearby.
More beautiful than anyone! I has an idea... maybe if you talks to her father and my mother... If you talks to them they might agree to let us be together. Yes, will you do this for me?  My Amoora!

Oh good... You will need to go to the ratongas and talks to my mother. You will needs to go to the kerra and talk to her father. Yes, you tells them we love each other and wants to spend our lives together for ever and always. You go tell them, all right?
Thanks you, thanks you!
I know! It's awful! I haves to think of something.
Oh my heart aches, I needs my Amoora. Our parents are set in the old ways. It seems like there is nothing that will change their minds about us. Wait, I haves an idea!  Will you do me a favor?
You go find my friend. My friend's name is Jojo.  He'll knows what to do. He always knows what to do.
My friend Jojo Karanja rests in the Seafarer's Roost in the City of Freeport. Jojo is very smart. Yes, he knows what to do. He help Amoora and mes.  He knows!
You'll do that for me? Oh thank you; you are a good friend. I will be grateful to you always!  Her fur is so soft...
Wonderful! I knews you could do it. Now, if somehow we can convice Jaharin.
Danger! There is much danger now. You came just in time to help me! She is in danger! You must helps me defend my Amoora.

The orcses! They're coming to hurts my Amoora. Oh, I couldn't let anything happens to my Amoora, my love, the passions of my life. No I would just die inside if anything were to happens to my Amoora. You will help me, yes?
When the orcses come, you fight them away. The orcses are coming to hurts Amoora and her family! We must not let them! We keep the orcses away!
The orcses are coming now. Quickly now, cross the river to her huts! We must stop the orcs from hurting my Amoora! I'll meets you there!

Well, I was right behind you... I was about to charge into the battle, but then I thoughts of Amoora and how upset she would be if I got hurt... Anyways, you were amazing! Thank you so much! Now I can be with my Amoora again! Here, takes this as a small token of my appreciation.

npcs.name: General Vhar'Taug
utterances: Intruders! Destroy them all!
Retreat! We are undone!
Welcome to your death, lesser being!
Back fools, there are too many!

npcs.name: Gersberms Gigglegibber
utterances: Happy Nights of the Dead!  I bet you're no scaredy-pants.  You wanna see how many creepsy ghosts you can collect?
Don't get scaredy!  Get to the Ghost Hunter starter pad, and you'll ride a holiday cloud.  Race around on it, collecting as many creepsy ghosts as possible!
Good job!  You caught a lot of ghosties!  Now I to count them, and give you reward!

npcs.name: Gerun Pontian
utterances: Gerun Pontian of the Militia. I watch the gates. I assure you a more dreary job does not exist in all of D'Lere.

Who attacks the gates of Freeport? Orcs? Dervish Cutthroats? Qeynosians? Hah! The only good thing about this post is it gives me a lot of time. And even the most daft of fools knows that time equals money.

Like I said, I've got free time. So while I'm out here I can acquire commodities that I can then sell to the merchants of Freeport. If I can't be out there earning glory, I'll stay back here and earn coin. Care to help?

Venom has been selling quite nicely. There are quite a few speckled rattlers around here. They're a great source of venom. If you bring me back the venom from eight of them I'll give you a portion of what the profit will be. Sound good?
Great! I'll be here, of course.
Did you get the venom?
Great! This will fetch a nice amount. There's more where that came from if you're interested.

Nah, this will take a while to sell. If I have more venom I risk driving down my own price. But there's plenty of wildlife around here that is willing to be exploited for our benefit! The shells of the small emerald beetles around here are very commonly used in jewelry. If you collect six of their shells I'll have enough to make a bulk sale. What do you say?
Excellent. Make sure they aren't cracked or anything!
Do you have the shells?
Great! Are you tired yet or can you do more?
All right. I've got some buyers lined up for some armadillo hides. You can find some if you follow the road west and along the wall that stretches to the north. I need ten of their hides.
I'm sure you will.
Did you get the hides?
Good work. You've made us both quite a bit of coin. Thanks for the help. I'm sorry that my tasks have been so dull. It's hard to pull the important missions when you're a lowly gate patrol.
I do have something a bit more exciting if you're interested.

Well, a while back I got a low priority assignment to take care of the ghostly orcs north of here in the Siegelands. I've been putting it off. I hate orcs almost as much as I hate ghosts. If you take care of these ghostly orcs for me I'll pay you what I was slated to receive. What do you say?

Great, that's a relief to hear. Don't worry about the spectral defenders. Like the ghostly orcs, they imagine they are in some never-ending war. I don't think they even realize they're dead. It's sad, really. Anyway, ghostly orcs: take out ten of them, those were my orders.
Are the orcs dead?

Ah, most excellent. Thank you very much. Listen... they sent you to me to see if you were able to get things done. I know I've been sending you around doing menial stuff, but you seem to follow orders quite well. If you're interested in working for us, and increasing your exposure--even to the Overlord himself--I have someone I can put you in contact with. Interested?

I thought you might be. He won't be sending you after any armadillos either! Go south of here, past the Turmoil Cemetery. There is an old, ruined tower where you can find Rainus Canton. He will have tasks for you, without a doubt.
May the Overlord hasten your path, <player name>.

npcs.name: a ghostly orc
utterances: I embrace Death.
At last, a chance for battle again.
Why does this always happen to me?
I see live people.

npcs.name: Gierasa Kulnovich
utterances: Come in, child, come in.  You must be so tired from your journeys.  Come, rest here.

Yes... the cards said you would come to us.  They said that time will no longer keep what is hidden from the eyes of the seeker.  They also said that death will be ascendant, but not for whom.  Yes... yes, you are the one.

I cannot deny the fate that the cards show me, errant one.  This is a world of worms, and death is but one of its kings.  You will find one who pledges her fealty to a single incarnation of this ruler, yet she seeks another incarnation instead.  Seek out the tower of the angry one and speak with the new house-souls.

Even though Zarvonn's tower is no longer here, it is easily found.  Within its spire you will find a woman who has many masters, but only acknowledges one.  Tell her that if she seeks Zarvonn's realm, she will surely find it.  She can see it evidenced within the siege of time.  Head to the south and head to the west and you will find the finger pointing to where Zarvonn exists... or perhaps... it doesn't.

Oh, I am just an old woman who has seen far too many years.  My companions and I  travel these lands.  We have been exiled from Freeport, and don't really like to settle in one spot, you know.  Too many parts of the world left to see.
Oh, there are many places left to visit, child.  The lands are not all gone, they are just a little hard to find.  You'll see, my dear.  I have a good feeling you'll find your way to them.

npcs.name: a Gigglegibber Goblin Gamblin' Game Vendor
utterances: Buy ticket, you!  Only ten shiny coins! You give just ten shiny coins and maybe you get um... many shinier coins!
Gigglegibber goblins not kill people! War no fun at all.  Gigglegibber goblins like shiny coins and funny things! We like frogs, fluffy kittens, potatoes... You have potatoes?

They tasty! Not funny!... though Gribbik carved funny face in a potato once.  That was funny until he eated it.  Hey! No try to tricks me with talk about potatoes.  You still pays ten shiny coins for ticket!  Buy many tickets! If you buys more maybe you win more than many shiny coins!

npcs.name: Gimble Cognoggin
utterances: No, no, that won't do.  Oh, whatever shall I do, it's too dangerous for me to do.  But need those reagents I do!   Why are you bothering me?  Can't you see I'm busy thinking?  No, too oblivious for that I'm sure!  You oaf!
Hmm ...  yes, yes, yes!  You CAN help me!  But what would it cost, I wonder ... I would have to divulge the components ... but I suppose I have no other choice.  Will you help me or not?

Folks are so greedy these days.  I suppose I don't blame them.  In recent years, it's become every gnome for himself.  I need you to venture into the Wailing Caves and retrieve some reagents. I can't tell you why I need them, but I will reward you well if you return with the ingredients. Here, let me write in your journal what I need.

YES! I'll be the first gnome to create this potion! You don't know what this means to me! And I suppose you don't really care. Fine then. Here's your payment. Let it never be said that Gimble Cognoggin welshed on a deal!

npcs.name: Grandma Twirlwhizzer
utterances: Oh dear me, who are you?

npcs.name: a grunt of Ree
utterances: Smash them!
Full retreat!  Regroup in the caves!

utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Guard Calog
utterances: Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!

npcs.name: Guard Fimi
utterances: Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?

npcs.name: Guard Laurio
utterances: All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.
Do you have business with the Freeport Militia?

utterances: The Overlord commands me to work the night shift and so I must accept.
All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.

npcs.name: Guard N'Garen
utterances: I'm tired of Safiya, that Kerra tires me with her madness.

npcs.name: Guard N'Ican
utterances: The Overlord commands me to work the night shift and so I must accept.
All praises to the Overlord.  The Militia protects loyal citizens of Freeport.
