utterances: The Overlord commands me to work the night shift and so I must accept.

npcs.name: Guard Trimalchio
utterances: The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: Guard Viridix
utterances: Do not challenge my authority, citizen.  In Freeport, the Overlord's word is law!
The Overlord commands me to patrol this area, and so I must.

npcs.name: Hanif
utterances: Those spared personal pain feel themselves called to assist the pain of others.  We must all carry our share of the misery which lies upon the world.  Wouldn't you agree?
That is a narrow outlook, but expected in this day.  I myself, have felt a calling to tend to the suffering of these unfortunate souls.

Indeed.  I follow the doctrines of the ancient Springview Healers.  A grand house of healers that felt themselves called to help attend to the pain of others.  I am able to ease the suffering of these outcasts, and that is rewarding.
What if I offered such crude rewards for your assistance?
Get me some medicinal aids to alleviate some of their discomfort.  The medicine can help alleviate the pain, as well as lengthen the patient's life.

npcs.name: Harbormaster D'Vey
utterances: The Overlord's Edge has left for Kylong Plains, it will be returning soon.
The Overlord's Edge will be leaving for Kylong Plains in 33 seconds.

npcs.name: Heron Cogcarrier
utterances: Ahoy ye bilge rat! Wha' ye be doing 'ere?
Avast! Ye not know who I be? I be ze dread piratess Heron... an' who migh' ye be?
Blimey!? Ye actually interested in 'elping? Well, me cap'ain and me crew seem ta be in a spo' of trouble, we do.
Arr, not so sure me trus' ye yet. Me needs ya ta dig up a treasure me pappy lef' ahind fa me.
Great! Bucko, take tha' multidirectional aerospanning locationater over there ta locate me treasure... Gar! And don' ye be forgetting me trusted shovel. Fair winds ta ye!
Did ye get the treasure yet?

Ye hand it over then and let me inspect ze treasure... Hrmm... Not going ta be able ta open this up 'ere. Ye let me know when ye ready ta board ze Sinking Sod II, tis a short ride ou' ta ze Smarmy Sprocket.
I've packed all me things.  Just hop in me dinghy when ye be ready ta set sail, <player name>.

npcs.name: a huntsman
utterances: You may win the battle, but the war is far from over!

npcs.name: Impelia Abettus
utterances: Please.  Don't come near me.  I'm very sick right now, and I don't want to harm anyone else.  Let me just pass.  In peace.

There ... maybe I can talk for a few minutes without coughing up a lung.  I don't know what I have, but I know where I got it.  The irony is that I was looking for information about the source of one threat, and wound up learning more about a completely different, yet just as deadly, menace.

I have been ... commissioned ... to find out what happened to Zarvonn, the Mad Mage.  Several hundred years ago, before Necromancy was widely accepted as a scholarly pursuit, Zarvonn explored the mysteries of the dead.  As a matter of fact, much of his initial research is still being taught at the Academy of Arcane Sciences.

He was kicked out of the Academy for his practices and vowed revenge upon all of Freeport.  He ventured out into the Commonlands and continued his research, taking up residence in a tower made from bone.  As time went on, he eventually remodeled the tower into a more contemporary design, one fashioned from old stones he specially selected.

Not exactly.  A hundred years ago, undead started appearing in much greater frequency in the Commonlands.  This alarmed the Academy to the point that they convinced the Militia to stop his threat by force.  When they arrived at his tower, he was gone.  The story goes, that when they searched the place, they found evidence proving he had been gone for a number of decades.

Or so the Academy believed ... they just wrote it off to the undead venturing out from the Kithicor Forest.  There was once a forest to the west of the Commonlands before the Shattering.  Now that a decade has passed since the Shattering ended, my... benefactors... wish to continue their research into the mysterious disappearance of Zarvonn.

It would be best if I didn't mention them.  The less you know, the safer you are.  I hate them with a seething passion, and if I still had my strength I'd slit every one of their throats ... who am I kidding ... I'm powerless against them. They own me more than any thrall could ever be owned.

Yes, back to what I was saying.  They feel that Zarvonn is still around ... somewhere.  According to the information I was given, they think there is truth to his promise, and that he will return.  The recent return of the undead is making them think he's still alive and is about to follow through with his vow.

I found an old manuscript of his that detailed his attempts at reanimating dead bodies, which ultimately led me to a dark, dark place.  Unfortunately, it was a false lead.  All I gained from that place was this wasting sickness. But I do believe the nomads may know more.

The nomads have been in the Commonlands longer than anyone can remember, at least four hundred years, according to my research.  I found an old scroll that hinted that they may have come from the Thundering Steppes.  Their oral tradition of history through story telling may reveal more.  I have no plans on pursuing this matter anymore, though.  I accept my fate, and don't expect to leave this tower until I've taken my final breath.

While I was pursuing my original assignment, I came across an old manuscript that I traced back to being penned by Zarvonn, the Mad Mage.  It took me a great while to translate it, but it seems he was researching how to reanimate dead bodies using the flesh of others.

I'm not too sure about that anymore.  I think he was trying to make something different, but wound up using Necromancy rather than whatever other force he was using to create his original versions.  In his research, he was using specimens that already existed, but weren't undead.  I can attest to that from first hand experience.

I tracked down where he found his original test subjects, and it led me into the Nektulos Forest.  It seems the "golems" he was originally using were coming from a mysterious manor, more a castle, actually.  I wasn't able to find out too much about the origins of the place, but it surely wasn't Teir'Dal in origin.

There's a rather lengthy story to the whole place, but I'm not sure what to believe anymore, considering what I saw in there.  Apparently, the place is called Nektropos Castle, and was originally built by someone named Everling.  This was so long ago that the facts have been lost through time.  Maybe some of the Teir'Dal that live in that dark forest might know more, but I already know more than I want to.

I wasn't able to find out if Zarvonn ever moved to Nektropos Castle, but if he did, he'd be dead by now.  That place is crawling with golems, and I'm certain malevolent spirits roam those halls.  I don't know if my sickness came from those golems, the spirits, or even something more ... frightening.  Look, I don't want to talk about this anymore.  If my benefactors want to know more about Zarvonn's tower, they can go speak with the nomads.

I don't know where we can find them.They have a tendency of moving around for whatever crazy reason they have in their heads.  The last I heard, they set up camp in the north.  Mind you, there are two different tribes that roam the Commonlands.  The ones I find to be a bit more friendly are led by an old woman by the name of Gierasa.  Now leave me to die in peace.

npcs.name: Importer Strathcona
utterances: Where is that courier?

npcs.name: Inquisitor Irizan
utterances: Stop! Get over here, now!
If you wish to incur the wrath of Freeport's might, by all means, don't do what you're told.  Complete these demands or bear the consequences.
I don't believe we've met. I am the Overlord's chief inquisitor. Oh, don't be nervous--that is, unless you have something to be nervous about.

Sure you're not and everyone in Freeport is a perfect angel, downright model citizens they are.  I have ways of finding out what I want.  Whether it's fact or fiction, that's what I get paid to decide.
Yes!  Indeed. What do I want?  You're a quick one. You'll serve me well, and if you don't I'll mark you as traitor to Freeport and our Overlord.  Is that understood?

I'm pleased that we've come to an understanding so quickly. My request is quite simple. I need you to recover a few items for me. That's it. Merchant Edmond is your contact; he'll tell you what you need to do. Is this clear?

npcs.name: Jaharin
utterances: What are you doing in here?
Ferink? Oh you mean the rat? Don't bother. Amoora needs a proper feline fellow, not some ... snack.
Love? Bah, I care not for the feelings of some mouse. Amoora will get over it.
The truth? The truth is my patience is at an end. Leave my home before I need to get... nasty.
Such a battle! We were barely able to hold them off the north hut. I saw what you did for us.
You are too modest a warrior. We are in your debt.
Yes, yes... I suppose so.
Well, I suppose that if he does care for Amoora enough to risk his scrawny little neck for us, then he can't be all bad.
Of course, go tell the rat... er... Ferink that he is welcome to feast this evening... Oh, and it won't be rat on the menu...
Thank you again for defending our home.
Yes?...

npcs.name: Janus Fieri
utterances: Greetings.  Janus Fieri, at your service.

npcs.name: Jereth Blackshield
utterances: I expected that rat Nethet to show up in order to save his friend.  It seems he sent a different sort of vermin in his place.
What do you want messenger?  This had better be good or I'll let the rest of the crew here have some fun with you.
Let me see that. ... ... hrm... ... the little rat does make an interesting offer.  I accept the bet.

Haha!  Why, the bet that you can beat my boys here in a fight to the death.  If you win I'll call off the contract on Nikora, if you lose I get double what Nikora owes me.  Judging by your looks I think I'm in for watching my boys deliver a good beating.
This time we get to kill the messenger.

npcs.name: Jerimiah Halstetter
utterances: Hey. Are you looking for something to do?

npcs.name: Jyrok the Stone
utterances: I cannot hold them much longer.

npcs.name: Kadek
utterances: Don't hurts! Money in mailbox outside.
...nnng...
What do the kerrans contribute to Freeport? Nothing!

npcs.name: Karmen the Swindler
utterances: Hey you! I got something you might be interested in...
Hello there! What can I do for you?

npcs.name: Kason Withershadow
utterances: Just fishing my cares away! You should pick up a pole and give it a whirl!

npcs.name: Keerah
utterances: What do you want?  I highly doubt my victims are coming to me nowadays just to hand me their valuables, so you must want something from me.

You'd live out here too if the Militia wanted your pelt.  Lift one bag of platinum from a tax collector and they get all up in a huff.  They didn't seem to mind when it was just foreigners who were losing things.

Now, that's an intelligent question.  How did the guards know?  Perhaps they employ a clairvoyant who saw me take it?  Maybe I tripped over my tail, the tax collector caught me, and I made a daring escape?  No!  Someone ratted me out!  When I find out who, I'll claw their eyes out!

npcs.name: a kerran rogue
utterances: You seem to believe in hopeless causes.
You'll never live to tell our tale!
Obviously not worthy of pack status.
Feel the searing pain of my claws!

npcs.name: a kerran vagrant
utterances: Feel the searing pain of my claws!
You'll never live to tell our tale!
Obviously not worthy of pack status.

npcs.name: Kraofla
utterances: Withdraw, fine comrades. I shall remain.

npcs.name: Kurzol Bonegnash
utterances: You ever ridez bovoch, instead of eatin' it?

npcs.name: Lady Anyanka Polevshi
utterances: Wait for me in the abyss, my comrade.
You shall pay for disturbing my eternal rest!
Even in undeath there is a final demise.

npcs.name: Leldwana
utterances: What do you want?
Oh no! I forgot! I'm so sorry. Here, take it, I have it right here.
I would invite you to stay, but...
You are not welcome to stay here, if that is what you were thinking.
Leave, please, unless you have business.

npcs.name: Lieutenant Vrah'Kna
utterances: Break your bones and eat your flesh!
Their death serves our cause.
Welcome to your death, lesser being!
They spotted us! Kill the witnesses!
Retreat! We are undone!

npcs.name: Lucanic Knight Initiate
utterances: This time there will be no escape!  Your kind is extinct and you will join them soon!
To arms!

npcs.name: Lucretias Domna
utterances: You are disturbing my studies here.  Begone, before I make you a walking cadaver!

npcs.name: Lucy Lovewing
utterances: There are lovely red roses blooming in the Enchanted Lands and New Halas!  It must be due to Erollisi Day.
Don't you just love Erollisi Day?

npcs.name: Madam Vi
utterances: I need some assistance. Would you be willing to aid me?

The heat out here is ridiculous and I am parched. I would do anything for some nice cool water. The water around here gets so filthy from the livestock. Even as hot as it is, I can't just drink any water, you know? Do you think you could go out and fill each of these flasks with clean water from the lake and river for me? Oh, and I will also need one of them filled from the sea. Mooshga always needs more salt for curing her specialties.
Do make sure there are no parasites in the water.
Hello again. Any news?
Excellent work!
Hello again. Do you have any further time to spare?
A section of my entourage seems to be lost out there. I need you to find them, give them the water you collected earlier, and relay their location to me.
Head out to the northwest. They have been missing for quite some time.
I wonder if they've set up camp yet.
Great news! Nothing like an ice cold drink on a hot day.
Hello, friend. My companions are rehydrated and back to themselves, thanks to you.
Wha..distracted? Hmm, well I suppose you are correct, but please do keep your observations to yourself in the future.

There is a gem that I truly desire which has evaded me.  I heard that it can be found by breaking open clumps of rocks inside the Wailing Caves to the west. Look for dull stone outcroppings near the vibrant blue rocks found inside.
Be careful, those caves are dangerous!
Have you completed your task?

npcs.name: Maharai
utterances: Something really needs to be done about our rat problem.
The gnawing, and the screeching, and the clawing... they're so NOISY.
Those rats across the river leave an awful stench wherever they go!

npcs.name: Marcus
utterances: Hello theres, hows can I helps you today?
Why yes, indeed, that poster is mine.  Yous are interested in the offer then?
Wells you see, just a short time ago a group of Rogue Magi came by here.  From the continent of Antonica they were...

Yes, Antonica.  Theys seemed to be fleeing something, banishments perhaps.  No matter though, you sees that rockpile over there?  It is actually the entrance to an ancient valley, one which holds a great many secrets...

Yes, that valley is where the magi have gone.  With my helps of course.  They had devised a potion that would allows them to pass through the rock unharmed....a Potion of Earthwalking if yous will.  In so doing theys required my assistance of course, for I am Marcus.

The potion that they had devised required certain ingredients....some of which they did not have in their possession.  Not knowing the area well they contracted me to assist them in gathering these items, for a fee, of course.  In the course of gathering their ingredients I was able to discern the secrets to creating this potion myself.
The magi, they depleted my stores you see, and I am out of a few key ingredients at this time.  If you were to gather them for me I would give you a potion, free of charge.
That's a nice book you have there, let me see it.  Yes, I'll jot down for you now the items I wills be needing.  Come see me again when you have them all.
Excellent, yous have gathered whats I need!  Gives them here...and yes, heres is your potion as I promised.  Marcus always stays true to his word, he does.

Yes, but it's a special potion.  Anyway, before you goes in theres, a words of warning for yous.  That valley is very dangerous and very old.  I know not whats has happened since the Magi have entered but terrible sounds have come from the valley in recent nights, howling, wretched sounds they are.
Ahh yess, but the treasures there, I am sure that they are amazing.  These are not the first magi to enter that valley you know, no's, they are not.
Oh yes, one last thing.  The potion, there is enough to cover three in a bottle but once opened it will only work once.  If you needs to go back for some reason, you know who to talk to.

npcs.name: Master Jaedra
utterances: Why does one like yourself feel the need to bug someone like me?

Mmmm... I could use some assistance with something I have been working on for the last few days. I need someone to go into the sewer system to the north of here and retrieve some stolen supplies from the goblins there.
Well, then let me know when you have collected everything.

npcs.name: Master of the Hunt
utterances: Stay clear of that lot down there.
What is it?  Did Iziran send you to check up on me?

That's the first lot of good news I've heard all day.  These undead orcs have no strategy, no rhyme or reason to their actions; they just continue to relentlessly, albeit feebly, attack our city. Huh?  Say, since Iziran didn't send you, are your skills for hire?
Splendid. A ratonga stole my hunting journal, the little wretch.  Find him, kill him, and return with my journal.  Is that understood?
You have my journal, yes?  Ahh, I am in your debt.  When you are ready, I will show you what it means to be the Master of the Hunt!
Why, when you're ready of course.

npcs.name: Merchant Edmond
utterances: Are you looking for something in particular?
So, you're the one he sent, huh?  I take it you want your assignment.
No, no you don't.  And don't go getting any funny ideas.  A bit of free advice, stranger: Don't cross Irizan.  That is one man you don't want on your bad side.  Got it?

All right. Find the dark elf at the other side of this here crossroads.  You can't miss her; just listen for the whiny little wretch.  You're going to lend her a hand.  Do what ever you can to help.  Your future is at stake.  Don't screw this up.  And whatever you find while aiding her, you return to me.  Understand?
Listen, pallie: either you do what I say or Iziran will send someone else to do this.  And if someone else has to do it, that's because you're dead.  Got it!?

npcs.name: Merchant Valary
utterances: My wares are the finest in the land. Won't you look?

npcs.name: Merchant William
utterances: Buy here!  Buy now!  Best goods you'll find in all the land.

npcs.name: Mindblaster Kander
utterances: Rock on! NOSTALGIA!!

npcs.name: Mnemir
utterances: What yous want?
What?! That's a lie!
I won't! I don't have it! I won't give you anything! You can't make me do anything!
OW!
...ugh!
Leave before Mnemir gets angry!

npcs.name: Mooshga
utterances: So, you be adventurer sent by Militia to help Mooshga? You look like you hungry! Mooshga feed you good!
Mooshga is greatest baker in all Commonlands! You want Mooshga make somethin' for you?

Mooshga hungry for jerky. Plus Mooshga try to make old secret recipe of famous ancestor chef. You go collect pieces for jerky so Mooshga can figure out recipe! It made from hyena meat. Get carrion hound ears for Mooshga.
Good...Yes, Mooshga make Hyena Jerky for you.
You back so quick! What you have for Mooshga?
Oh, thanks you! You make Mooshga happy Ogre.
You still look hungry! You hungry? Mooshga knows when people hungry. Mooshga will feed you but you do something for Mooshga first.
Mooshga make special surprise today. Mooshga needs claws for surprise recipe she figure out.

Mooshga need special claws from crabs. The HUGE ones. You find crabs in southeast. They live in freshwater. Near old tower there is good spot. You go find crabs and snap tasty claws off, then bring back to Mooshga.
Mooshga will make seafood surprise for you!
Mooshga makes you some too. Here you go.
The pot! Mooshga not believe what happened.

Well...  Mooshga was cooking. After put water in Moosgha's cooking pot when fire was really hot, tasty squirrel run by. Mooshga thought would make tasty appetizer for dinner. Mooshga chased tasty and forgot about boiling pot.

No, squirrel got away. When Mooshga return, all water was boiled away and pot got too hot. Mooshga tried put more water in pot, but pot cracked. Now Mooshga can't cook. Maybe you can help Mooshga fix pot?
Okay! You go harvest the iron clusters for Mooshga and then can fix pot!
Oooo... good! Mooshga gets back to making her goodies again. Mooshga don't need all iron to fix pot. You keep rest of iron.
You hungry now? Mooshga has idea for next meal. Come close so Mooshga not let others know secret of ancestor's recipe.
Mooshga knows what you like. Do you know of old statue on way to docks at sea?
Good. Go to statue and find wisps. You bash them and bring back some for Mooshga. Mooshga make something good for you. You go get wisp essences for Mooshga! Mooshga will make yummy wisp tofu for you.
Wisp tofu is delicious!
Mooshga very happy. Try some tasty Mooshga made.
Mmmmm... You smell that? Mooshga gets ready to bake muffins. You want some?
Mooshga's favorite! Rhino muffins! Mooshga have no parts to next batch. If you want try muffins, you need get Mooshga ingredients.
Mooshga need three-toed rhino feets. You go get three-toed rhino feets for Mooshga, then will make best muffins for you!
Yes. Rhino muffins very crunchy. Go collect for Mooshga.
Just what Mooshga need. This good for big batch.
You come to help Mooshga again?

npcs.name: Mylitta
utterances: Your eyes are so pretty.

npcs.name: a mysterious contact
utterances: Hmm.  The time had past.  Luck is that I am forgiving.
A point of such truths.  I am to relay that the next shipment is ready.
Good.  So far, the leader has been impressed.  Do see that it continues.

npcs.name: Nethet
utterances: Yous comes to Nethet to speaks of things yes?  What's it that you wants to knows?
He's lookings for his precious cargoes now is he?  That's what one gets for dealings with others than ratonga, we is always reliables, yes?
I don't knows... yet, but I cans finds out I promises.
I can't just gives my secrets aways for free now cans I?   Maybe if you do me a favors I helps try to find out for you hrm?  We have a deals?

I has a friends whos in troubles with the Blackshield smugglers.  He went to speaks with thems but I'm not sures they wanted to chat.  I'm thinkin' he's needin' a hand from someones likes you.  If you helps him I'll be thinkin of where Brandus' cargo might be.

He wents north along the coast.  He says the Blackshield have their own dock to do their business just northwest of the flying griffin tower.  Makes sure you come in from the land, they watches the docks carefully and its dangerous.  Look for anothers ratonga, his names is Nikora.
I knows.
Yous is back.  Whats did you learn of my friend?

The Blackshields you say?  Hrm... this is no goods, we can't haves any fightings with thems.  Can you takes this notes to Jereth Blackshield?  He is nones friendly and you'll have to gets close to him through his guards but he should takes it.
Yes, yes, of courses.  You do favors for Nethet, he does favors for you.  Pleases goes now, and gives the notes to Jereth.
It's good to see yous again, whats did Jereth have to say about my offers?
Oh, no, no, no!  That's not true, I only gaves Jereth options.  I can't helps if he chooses ones you don't likes.   You were the winner weren't yous?  See, I knows what I'm doings.
They aren't so importants.  Other coins, secrets I knows he wants, special other thingses.  He seems to wants to sees blood this days, not my faults.
Yes, yes, I knows, but you wins and you gets what Nikora owed hims.  It's yours now, here.  That make things all betters now, yes?
I remembers what yous lookings for.  Yes, I keeps promises, bad for businesses not to.  I spoke to manys contacts and finds information on your friends missings cargo.
He was not dealings with peoples he shoulds.  And his cargoes was not somethings loyal citizens of Freeport should be having.  He was bringings in refugees to haves shipped back outs to sea.

Nots untils he has a sorcerer friend wipes or changes their memories and gives them overs to a captain in the Far Seas Trading Company to take to the Outpost of the Overlord.  He gets a cuts of the coins that Freeport pays for the refugees... twice or maybe even three or more times.

Yes, yes, backs to business, I'm sorrys for wanderings in my speakings.  The Dervish Cutthroats has thems now, and the sorcerer friend of Brandus.  They be trying to takings his businesses I'm guessings.

npcs.name: Nikora
utterances: What are you doing?  Get down!  They'll see you!
Shhh!  Quiet, I'm trying to listen to this.  And I said, get down!  We'll talk in a minute.
Now, what is it that they are up to I wonder...
I assume Nethet sent you?

That's true I'm in a bit of a bind.  If you can help me then I'll put in a good word to Nethet to help you out with whatever you need.  I can't very much make a deal with these smugglers if they are trying to kill me.

Are you insane?  No, I just need the assassins they've sent after me to disappear if you know what I mean.  If they can't do the job then I can live long enough to have Nethet smooth all this misunderstanding out.

Many thanks friend, I'll let Nethet know about this, he should help you out with whatever you need.  I'm going to stay here a while longer and see if the Blackshields have anything else up their sleeves.

npcs.name: Nosno
utterances: The Overlord's might casts a great shadow over these lands. It is wise of Qeynos to stay far, we would crush them.
I was once small and weak. I have grown.

npcs.name: an orc emissary
utterances: Intruders! Destroy them all!
Back fools, there are too many!

npcs.name: Orc ghost
utterances: The living come to try their luck.
At last, a chance for battle again.
This is not the end of the journey.
I embrace Death.
Why does this always happen to me?
I'm already dead, how bad can it be?

npcs.name: an orc runner
utterances: Intruders! Destroy them all!
Back fools, there are too many!

npcs.name: Orwen Neovra
utterances: She's gone! There was nothing I could do. Once I finish this cutter, that will all change. I got a few scars that I need to return to their dealers.
My wife, Ariana.  Bleeding in the dust, I watched the orcs drag her away. But when I finish this blade, I'll retrieve her from the grasp of those evil orcs!

npcs.name: Overseer Melicinn
utterances: Yes... you'll do nicely.
Thanks to some other foolish adventurers, I've found a way to get to Zarvonn and the power he possess.  In order for me to obtain what I'm after, he must be destroyed.  This is where you come in.

Silence!  Listen to me fellow Freeportian!  You would do well to use the two ears you have and close your one mouth!  Muster some fellow adventurers of like mind and strength then delve into Zarvonn's domain.  Once inside, destroy him and his minions, but do not spoil nor take what you find, for it will be that which you do not understand.  I will see to those... personally.
Because the Overlord demands it!  Do I need to tell you twice?  The last adventurer I had to tell twice is now a mindless undead servant.  Care to join him?

Much better, it pleases me to see you have come to your senses.  Gather as many people as you can, for you will need more than six to defeat Zarvonn, that much is certain.  When you are ready to travel into his domain, I will cast a spell which will allow you to use the portal before you.
Now don't run off, this will only take a moment.

npcs.name: a parched nomad
utterances: Sure is a hot one today. How do you fare, traveler?
Oh really? What might that be?
Oh excellent! Just what the doctor ordered, so to speak. The others will appreciate this also. The Crossroads, you say? I think we can get word to her there. Thank you again for you kindness.
Hello again!  The water was wonderful, hit the spot.
Mighty hot out here in the Commonlands, one can build up quite a thirst.  Have you seen a Madam Vi perhaps?  We seem to have lost her.

npcs.name: a patchcraft keeper
utterances: Hey, you hit me with something I want NOW!
For Bristlebane! He likes me best.

npcs.name: a plains hunter
utterances: Do not surrender to the invaders!
Cover me while we regroup!
That sure wasn't curiosity!

npcs.name: a Qeynosian protector
utterances: Keep up the assault, no matter what the cost in lives!

npcs.name: a Qeynosian scout
utterances: My friend may have fallen like a rotten tree but I will not.
You cannot kill us all, despoiler!

npcs.name: Rainus Canton
utterances: The orcs?

Wonderful job, <player name>! The orcs will be feeling this for a while. In theory we could harry them endlessly if their leader never returned. That would make an interesting study to return home with. Speaking of that, I got word back on the orc roots.

That the orcs are more stupid than we thought. The elixir they create is triggered whenever the orc's adrenaline gets high enough. When this happens it actually eats away at the orc's brain! This damages the orc permanently. This is, of course, perfect.
If it's good enough for one clan of orcs why not others? I'd like you to deliver some of these treated roots to Captain Feralis at the Crossroads for me.
Good, good. He may have work for you once you get there. Once again, great work out there!
Rainus Canton, a once wandering sword now bound in service to the Overlord. And yourself?

<player name>, indeed. Your name has graced the lips of many I have had the fortune--or misfortune--to listen to. It is a, ehm--a pleasure to meet you. Are you out here in the service of the Overlord as well?
Splendid. Perhaps you would care to join me in earning his favor.

Captain Feralis has been tasked with re-confirming the orc threat to Freeport. No, that doesn't mean we fear they could ever bring the city down, but even a gnat can annoy and pester. Feralis has asked me to help him, and I have agreed.

Harassing the Bloodskulls, of course! And in doing so learning of their strengths and weaknesses. I've found them typical, so far. But one thing does stand out, their reliance on a thick root that grows around here.

Bloodskull Frenzy Root. The Bloodskull shamans provide their orcs with a solution that combines with the root to create an elixir that sends the orcs into a rage once they're in combat. All the tests we've run on the weed have so far turned up nothing and we've run out of samples. Care to lend a hand?

Head west of here. Once you find the orcs, pay your respects to the Overlord: kill some of the Bloodskull warriors and priests. However, and this is the important part, I would also like some samples of the Frenzy Root. The shaman mixture we have, don't worry about that, but bring me at least five root samples.
Return to me once this is done, I'll have more work for you.
Have you done as I asked?
Good work, <player name>. I'll get these to our alchemist for study.

That's right. I believe the orcs in this region are acting without new orders, they seem to be somewhat stagnant, or at the very least slow. They either have an inept leader or an absent one. I'd like you to head to the ruined towers west of here. There are some Bloodskull tower guards, kill them and search the corpses for the standing orders for these Bloodskull orcs. I'd like to see what they're working toward, if anything.
While you do that maybe we can figure out how better to unlock the power of this root. Good luck!
Did you slay the orcs and get the orders?
Wonderful. Unfortunately we still don't have any word on the root.
Give me a moment, the orcs aren't known for their grammar.
It looks like these are orders to build up a "cha nu durk." Which is--I think--the minimum size of a orc fighting unit.

Carnage, no doubt. Orcs always wear their hearts upon their sleeves. The only thing a force that small would be useful for is routing civilians... Maybe a hit and run force for the Crossroads... ah hah!

I read the orcs as books. They've two camps south-west of the Crossroads, just south of the kerran and ratonga villages. The orcs of these two camps will likely make up the cha nu durk... Kill the orcs and destroy their supplies. If they have a siege tower, destroy it as well.

It's just a theory, but if they harass the kerrans and ratongans enough it may attract some militia attention. If that is their goal, perhaps they're looking to attack the Crossroads. If that isn't their plan, I am near certain they are going after the villagers, so put a stop to them regardless. We can't have the orcs killing civilians, who would we tax otherwise, eh?
Return when you're not so green.

npcs.name: Riki
utterances: What do you want?
Yes? I'm sorry, we don't need any more supplies until the end of the month. Good day.
Ferink? What about him? Is he still moping by the river about that cat?
Don't say her name to me! It's ridiculous, really, being in love with a killer for goodness' sakes!
Love? Children know nothing of love! It's out of the question! Now, since you are wasting both of our time here, please leave me be. I have the day's chores to see to.
You again? You just don't get it, do you?
I highly doubt you have anything I would find interesting.
I'm listening...
Duia... Duia... oh... well, yes but he was an exception... I mean, they are not all like him. Such a kind man, er, cat... Well, you know what I mean.

A rememberance necklace! Oh, it's just gorgeous. I must send him my thanks.  Sigh... I suppose sometimes the wisdom of children is overlooked by the ways of the elders. I will give this Amoora a chance. Tell Ferink he has my blessing.

npcs.name: Rilkrik
utterances: Not everything I have for sale is useful to everyone. Keep that in mind.
Hah, guess you've got no idea who you're talking to. Rilkrik here. I'm somewhat of an orc scholar, in all honesty.
By Argorym's blade!

A saying among orc scholars... I guess it's sort of elitist, Raegnir isn't that widely known, but the blade is and Raegnir held it. Knowledge of obscure trivia helps make one feel special. Anyway, this is part of the blade from which that saying originates: Argorym's blade.

Argorym is an orc of legend about whom little is known. Feared in combat, immortal to his enemies, and so on. Raegnir was one of many Deathfist outcasts who came to live in the Commonlands. He rallied orcs under his banner. Unlike most orc leaders he never sought to create a massive army of orcs.

Raegnir sought only the strongest, fiercest orcs. His army--squad may be a better word to describe it--was quite feared once. He led a mission within the walls of Freeport--can you imagine that? An orc INSIDE Freeport--and was killed by orcs who thought a few shots from a catapult might help his mission. They brought down a building on Raegnir's entire crew and an unlucky guard captain. If you've found a part of his blade then perhaps you can be the one to return it to him.
Not exactly, but his grief is known to all who know him. He was no mere orc, <player name>. To respect the memory of a fierce warrior is neither shameful nor treasonous.

Gather the remnants of his sword. Legend says it was broken down, the blade and the two jewels: the children of the sky. The leather wrap has long since rotted, I am certain, but that is less important than the blade and the jewels. Once you have collected these items travel to the Siege Lands.
Find the spirit of Raegnir and offer the blade pieces to him. Whatever gods you worship and wherever your alliances stand, Raegnir will appreciate the offer.
Good, gather all the pieces: Argorym's blade, the Daughter of the Sky, and the Son of the Sky. With these Raegnir's memory will be honored.
Good luck!

npcs.name: a roekillik digger
utterances: Work, work, work!

npcs.name: Ronam Olansk
utterances: Please stay away from here! The dead souls of orcs callout for vengeance, and I'll not put you or the rest of my people in danger.

I'm not so certain...  but I suppose there's no harm in letting you risk your own life trying.  If you kill enough of the skeletons inside the cave, the skeletons outside may return to their resting place.  My people and I will scrape together what little we have to pay for your services.

I know the task will not be easy.The halls of the Wailing Caves are haunted with the angry, tormented ghosts of orcs left to a grisly death by the members of the Freeport Militia.  I imagine quite a few will need to fall before any progress can be made.

Thank you for what you have done for our camp here.  We nomads are not the most wealthy of individuals, but here is a token of our appreciation for your assistance in the matter.  I fear that the dead shall rise again all too quickly.  Perhaps it will be better to just move on...

npcs.name: Rootka
utterances: What you wants with Rootka?
Someone takes them, then! Tries to make Rootka looks bad!
Fine, fine! Rootka understands. How much?
Here, take it. Rootka likes living more than money anyway.
The kerrans plot against us, you must warn the Overlord!

npcs.name: a runner of Ree
utterances: Smash them!
Full retreat!  Regroup in the caves!

npcs.name: Sergeant Borus
utterances: You best watch your step out here!

npcs.name: a Shin`Ree avenger
utterances: The living wander too close.
It's only a minor setback.
You made your final mistake.
Ahhhiiiheeeee!
Going somewhere?
The dead don't feel pain.
There can be no end to us.

npcs.name: a spectral defender
utterances: I will not lose count, and you will suffer the lot!
My comrades spirit rests ... for now.
You cannot truly kill what is already dead.
They will rise again. They always do.

npcs.name: Spirit of Raegnir
utterances: My pain is eternal.
Why do you bother me?
My blade! I thought I had lost it in that blasted city.
No. I am unable to rest because I was betrayed.

By my own people! I got the crazy idea in my head that we could sneak into Freeport at night and take out a guard captain. The captain's head would be merely a worthless trophy, we had dozens already. But the fact that we stole it from his very shoulders while he slept... THAT was to be the real prize. But it all went wrong...

No one knew of our plan that wasn't of orc blood. Orcs aren't known for their smarts, but we don't talk. Some might, sure, if they were captured. But I specifically toned down our presence so as to avoid any capture. And we did avoid it. We had not a single orc unaccounted for in two weeks, completely unheard of. But the Militia had set a trap for us.

We crept into the house of the guard captain. We had gone not three steps when there came a terrible crashing from all around us. The guard in his bed? Probably just some pillows under the covers. They had set the entire house up as a trap, and it worked. Every last one of us they got, crushed under that falling mess of stone...

Who knew? Not a single orc captured or missing. And ONLY us orcs knew. One of them told the Militia... I bet they gave him enough gold to keep him happy for a day or two and then killed him. Why not? He's just an orc, ya know? And a traitor at that. Betrayal hurts... more than any wound a sword or axe can give.
What do you mean?
... they hit the house of the guard captain?
Hah hah hah. So we sneak into Freeport to kill some guard captain, get killed, and the poor guy dies anyway? Hah hah hah! Oh, the world works in interesting ways.
No. No they did not. You bring me my weapon and my peace. I think I will leave now. Thank you.
It is missing.

npcs.name: Squire Hadley
utterances: The curse of Gynok torments us all! Who will be brave enough to lift this wretched taint and free the Order of Marr's Fist?

npcs.name: Surveyor Menak
utterances: Yes?  You are asking a question to be answered?

I am looking at things.  Looking closely.  All this land unused!  Unused!  That is a waste.  We will fix that.  We know our way around dirt!  Dig up some here, push dirt aside there.  Yes, yes; this is perfect.
Nothing stands in the way of progress!  They may stay or they may go.  Might be better if they go, so the dra...drafts do not upset them.  Digging goes on, very drafty.

Wind blowing.  Smell that? That is why we are good at this: our noses are very sensitive.  The littlest change in the air and we know.  Some things are here at our feet.  Other things are farther away.

One thing we smell is that which we seek.  Our investors tell us what we must seek.  It is underground and so we dig.  Our engineer studies how to get what we seek.  Ask the engineer about the dirty work. The other thing we smell is that which we want.  Your legs are long.  Can you help us find what we want?

Excellent!  I know this is not nice to say about those we do not know, but there is a village in the Commonlands full of little ones.  They took the Wheel and we must get it back.  Go there, look around.  They are not nice.  The Wheel is ours!

A tour?  I am afraid that I cannot.  You might check directly with one of the miners.  Yes, that is the best thing for you to do.  Perhaps Razcsko can direct you; he knows all the miners.  Yes, ask Razcsko.  He is usually at the mines in the Steppes.

npcs.name: Taskmaster's Assistant Koz'ma
utterances: Bring your FSR's to me.  If you don't have them, then I don't want to talk to you.
Where's your requisition? Only those who filled requisitions should speak to me.

Lets me see ... Yes, yes! Here we are. This order is overdue, and the Far Seas Trading Company never pays full price for late orders. Consider yourself lucky that you get paid at all.  Thank you, come again.

Why are you wasting my time? The Far Seas Trading Company pays huntsmen to track down various items and beasts. Sometimes the huntsmen inadvertently feed the beasts and never return. Too bad ... for them.
No! No, no, no! We have plenty of huntsmen!  No more huntsmen! And that means you!  Okay?  Got it?  ... That is, unless of course, you happen to find an unfilled order. Get it?

npcs.name: Tecera Valnos
utterances: Make it quick, I am quite busy.
It's about time he sent help. I've nearly lost the band of Bloodskulls I'm tracking and now this business with the Ruins of Val'marr.
We got new orders a while back. We were to keep a close watch on the undead north of here. So we started to watch. So far... nothing, yet we continue to waste resources.

It is not our job to question our orders, only to follow them. In dealing with these undead we set up some arcanic sentries about the ruins. Now those have been disabled and we're left with far less than what we started with. Meanwhile I'm working hard to keep my scouts on top of the Bloodskulls we had been tracking before. Needless to say things are hectic around here.

That's what I like to hear! We need the arcanic sentries back in action. The undead are too stupid to have taken them out--perhaps that's why our superiors are so interested in this area. The sentries are equipped with rudimentary magic that can conceal their location from future attacks, however. Before that will work they need to be repaired.

We've got supplies cached in the houses south of the ruins. Some of those crates will contain essence injectors. You only need one. Once you have one, head into the ruins. The undead that are destroyed rot into undeath... and that can be reaped. Collect an essence of undeath from one of the fallen undead and use it with the injector to repair one of the sentries. After that collect another essence and repair the next one.
There are six: two above the road that runs east and west, and four below it. They are all on the outskirts of the ruins. Think you can do it?
Good. Return to me once they're all repaired.
Are the sentries repaired?
Great work! This is going to save us a lot of scouting time. Thank you, <player name>.
We got another lucky break. Our scouts report that the Bloodskulls we had been following have settled down and are doing some strange research.

Something having to do with the ghostly treants they've set up camp near. They're orcs so I doubt it's very advanced... still, I would like you to get rid of some of the shamans doing the research. The less the orcs have to work with the better off we are.

They have two leaders: Vurog Ma'gar and Jyrok the Stone. Take them out. Then find Arnisu Tobian. He is posing as their prisoner. Get his report on their studies and bring it back to me. This strike will be enough for our needs, but will not force the Bloodskulls into an action we won't be ready to deal with.

From the southern most branch of the river it is south. There will be a small path leading into the mountainous area. That path will lead to their camp. It is on the southern edge of the Commonlands, east of the entrance to Bloodskull Valley.
Thank you, and be careful.
Have you done it all?
Great! Finally things are coming under control. You've done a lot for us, <player name>, thank you.
Hmm... orcs raising the dead. Perhaps this is the missing bit of information that connects the Bloodskulls to the Shin'Ree.
At this point you're better off not knowing. If you are needed you will be called upon. For now, I would return to Feralis if I were you. I'm sure he'll want to thank you personally.
Thanks again. Goodbye.

npcs.name: a Thexian dragoon
utterances: There is no escape for you now!
Hold them and I'll return with help!
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: a Thexian excavator
utterances: I hope you put your affairs in order.
More intruders to deal with?  Stop them!
I have no time for meddlers.  Destroy them!
There is no escape for you now!
Welcome to torment and destruction!
Fall back, order a tactical retreat!
No matter what I promise, you will not survive!
I will have vengeance!
Hold them and I'll return with help!

npcs.name: a Thexian rebel
utterances: I will have vengeance!
Hold them and I'll return with help!

npcs.name: Tiff Squeelunkle
utterances: Psst!  You there!  C'mere and give me a hand.
You are a perfect fit!  No doubt of that cog being wrong sized, nuh uh.

I have need of you!  I'm a member of the Seafury Buccaneers, and we... I know what you're thinking, but I am very useful at sea!  Any mechanical whos-its break down durin' travel and Tiff is on it like stink on a sewer rat.

Uh... Oh, yes.  You're useful 'n smart!  we're to investigate these smugglers 'ere and see what and who is behind their recent growth in number 'n purse. 'Nfringin' on our teritry, they are.  I have the clothes of a courier 'ere for you to wear when you go in.

Huh?  Keep up 'ere!  I need you to go to the smuggler's camp.  I'll reward you, naturally.  I promise!  Break my gears, and curse my mind!  It's just that I've been spotted by 'em several times snoopin' around 'n if I get snagged again they'll sure as Prexxus take my other hand, too!
Do not distract me from the matter.  You're the one that wanted to help me!
Clues, of course!  Who is funding 'em.  What're they shippin'.  That kinda' stuff.
Now wear this outfit so they will not suspect you.  They are the clothes of the last courier to have come through.  Careful, they're worn through in parts.
Back all ready!?  What 'cha find?
I knew it!  What have you for me?
Oh, what luck!  I hadn't expected this.  Too good!  What are you to do with it?
No.  It's magically sealed, and if broken the scroll will combust.  What did they want you to do with it?
Too good, 'ndeed!  'Ere let me sprinkle it with tracking powder, and then deliver it.
A magical concoction that will allow us to track the scroll to its destination.
Quite, quite.  Now 'urry along, less we miss our chance!
Do tell, do tell!  What 'appened?
Excellent!  'Ere.  Take this for your troubles.
Now we can track the scroll to 'elp us learn who is involved, but there's more gears turnin' in this clockwork then meets the eye.
Aye, there is!  What's bein' shipped, where?  What dark elves wanna help others?  Trackin' the items is key!  'Cept, it's too bad I'm out of the trackin' powder.
Sassy!  Talk'n like that is how I lost my tongue, you know.  At sea, they don't take kindly to such.  Wait!  You could get me sa' more.  Good idea!
Get me five wisp embers to make the potion, and we'll be all set.
I 'ave the potion all set.  You've got the wisp embers?
Good, good!  There we go.  Now take this pouch of trackin' powder, and sprinkle it on any of 'em empty crates that are in the Blackshield Smugglers' outpost.  'Urry now.  Don't dawdle!
Ack!  You startled me!  Don't you know better than to sneak up on someone?!
Didn't mean to jump.  I think I was just distracted.  I was busy watchin' the scroll you delivered earlier.  So far, it's traveled southeast followin' the river towards Freeport.
Yes.  I must keep my good eye on that while you're gone.
Don't know.  But the map does!  Follow the crates' movement and see where they go.  Here, you take the map.
Oh... No matter!  You can keep an eye on it as you follow the crates.
You seem a wee out'a breath.  Somethin' wrong?
Do tell!  Where did the crates end up?  What did you finds?
Hmm.  That is curious.  I was of thinkin' that they were only in Nektulos.
What of the scroll?  What's the map show you of it?
Longshadow Alley?  What could be there?  Lemme see the map.
You sure it was in Longshadow Alley?  It is gone now!
Spell must have been brok'n or the scroll destroyed.  Oh, lookee!  The crates are back at the smugglin' dock.  What luck!
Oh, wonderful idea!  I'm almost thinkin' you from Qeynos the way you are so obligin'.
Did'n you find somethin'?  Anythin'?
Stop with the suspense!
Wha?  Then they are fundin' the smugglin' with the shipments, themselves.  Payment is the shipment of gems 'n ore.
Oh!  So sneaky.  They been fundin' the smugglers as a diversion.  That is why we had not realized their growth and activities in the Commonlands!
We Buccaneers may be able to break in on this 'n extract a bit of that profit.  Either by attacks at sea or by gettin' protection taxes from the smugglers themselves, now that we know the plans, too.
I know, ya' rapscallion!  Here is the payment.  You earned it.
I appreciated your 'elp investigatin' the Smuggler's activites.

npcs.name: a Tortured Maid
utterances: Mortal agony is nothing compared to the torment that awaits you!
You cannot run from death, mortal!
You will see us again in your nightmares!
You cannot kill what is already dead!

npcs.name: a tortured soul
utterances: You will see us again in your nightmares!
I will show you the true pain of death!
You cannot kill what is already dead!
You cannot run from death, mortal!
Mortal agony is nothing compared to the torment that awaits you!

npcs.name: Tundis N`oxyle
utterances: Do not interrupt what is undoubtedly the most important discovery in the past three hundred years.  Be gone, I have much work to attend to here.
Is that so? First you must prove yourself. Strength of mind and body is required in the deep halls. The weak are worthless to us.
As you wish.  There are giants in this valley made from the living rock. Bring me five stones from the bodies of these creatures, and I will know that you are strong enough to be one of us.

So you have.  In order to become a member of the Thexian loyalists, you will need to be ordained and formally welcomed to our ranks.  You will join our group at the meeting in Freeport and receive a key to the Gate. Now, leave me to continue my research.

npcs.name: Ventar T'Kal
utterances: Are you <player name>?
Good, good. That means Feralis thinks you're able to help me.
The orcs of Ree, living and dead alike.
I don't know the specifics, but the orcs of Ree inhabit this land and so do their skeletons. Only recently, however, have the living emerged from the Wailing Caves. They are becoming bolder.
Poison them. When I heard of Rainus' roots I smelled an opportunity.

My intent is to get you to do work for me while I continue dealing with these nomads. What do I intend you to do on my behalf? I'd like you to travel west of here with the root, they have an encampment there. When you reach the orcs, place it near them. Let them consume it. From there I'm sure nature will take its course.

If they get as addicted as Rainus claims the Bloodskull orcs are, this may be the key to drawing the strength of the Ree orcs out from underground. Press your advantages, <player name>, that's what I always say. Speaking of which, while you're there I would like you to find the Ree encampment. Once there, find a current copy of their orders. I'd like to be as up to date as possible.
Is it done?
Nice, very nice. Give me a moment while I read over these orders.
Interesting, quite interesting. I may have been wrong on their intentions.
I had thought the Ree orcs to be attempting to expand outward from the Wailing Caves. That may still be their intent, but this specific group of orcs is not here for that reason.

Treasure hunting. Their orders are to seek out some sort of ancient Shin'Ree box. It appears one of their agents already had it in his possession. He buried it for safe keeping but was slain. However, it would seem he expected death and had word delivered to his people, though he didn't mention its exact location.

They list it simply as "useful." I don't know what that means to the orcs specifically, but I would prefer they didn't have it. The orders mention a shipment landing at the Blackshield Docks. I imagine the shipment will lead us to this package before the orcs...

Two ways, both involving the orc courier. I am not sure precisely how old these orders are, but the sooner we act the better. Find the runner of Ree. If he is on his way to the docks then kill him and take the shipping receipt. Use it to get the package from the docks. If you catch the runner on the way from the docks then he will have the shipment, in which case you can take it directly from him. He'll be somewhere between the Ree camp west of here and the docks.
I know you will. Bring me the shipment as soon as you have it.
Did you get the shipment?
Excellent work.  If I am right this will tell us where the orc buried this "useful" treasure. Give me a moment, please.
Perfect. It's somewhere near the Nektulos Station griffin tower, west of here. Go find it, dig it up, and bring it back to me.
"Useful," bah, my illiterate grandmother could write better than that.
Did you get it?
Aye. I've read more of the Ree orders. This is an old relic from the Shin'Ree clan. Apparently the "key" to opening it was, "...a Shin'Ree orc with bloodied hand."
I'm afraid it's not that simple.

Well, orc magic is simplistic but it isn't something we can simply ignore. If the key to this chest is the bloodied hand of a Shin'Ree orc then that is what we must find. The skeletal orcs outside of the Wailing Caves are what's left of the Shin'Ree orcs. Among them you can find blood stained bones... which means hands. Unfortunately I doubt any of the skeletal orcs have preserved their bloody hands for us. But there is still a way.

We can build a bloody hand ourselves! Slay the Shin'Ree orcs. Among their fallen bones collect the bloodied fingers--enough to form a hand. That will fulfill the needs of this orc spell, I am certain.
Indeed you will, then you will see what spoils we reap in such jobs as these.
Do you have the fingers?

Yeah, yeah. Maybe next time we won't be so unlucky. Anyway, I neglected to mention this earlier--after all I wanted to get as much from you as I could--but Feralis has been asking for you. You should go speak with him, I believe he has another underling who could use your help.
Hurry off now, Feralis has been expecting you.
I've heard of your deeds. Good show. You learn fast, I can tell.
These nomads can be quite pleasant to deal with.
Overlord protect us!

Good, good... Opening it should be as simple as... yes! A sash?... worthless. And under it? ...paper... The Code of the Shin'Ree? Useful? USEFUL? It's nothing but PAPER!Still, I suppose it isn't a complete waste. I guess some historian would part with some gold to have it. Alas, <player name>, I am sorry for the disappointment. Here, maybe you can find use of this sash.

npcs.name: V'tal Narin
utterances: Why hasn't my brother written me? What happened to him? Citizen, why are you bothering me?
You ridicule my loss as well!
You haven't heard about my brother's failed expedition into Fallen Gate?

Three months ago, my brother left on an expedition to look for an old family heirloom in Fallen Gate. About two weeks ago he stopped writing me, and I'm afraid he lost the heirloom. I would look for it but I must take care of important matters here.
If you find the heirloom, I will pay for your services. If you can, find out what happened to my worthless brother.
Excellent ... in the last letter I received from him, he said he found my family's heirloom and was returning with it.  I have not heard from him since.
That is information you need not know.  My brother took a small lockbox to carry the item.  When you find him, he should have the box.
If that is so, then bring me just the box. It is made of dark wood and has a falcon engraved on its lid.
Get away from me! You're like the others!

npcs.name: Vurog Ma'gar
utterances: Welcome to your death, lesser being!
Back fools, there are too many!

npcs.name: Watcher Ommo
utterances: Your service is required, citizen.
Whatever He desires. You will give your service to the Commonlands in His name and report to Gerun Pontian here in the Commonlands at the gates to the City of Freeport.
Serve the Overlord well, citizen. May you have all the luck you require.

npcs.name: Wounded Scout
utterances: All of them dead... we never had a chance...

The orcs got everyone... the whole expedition was wiped out... I'm all that's left of a score of soldiers.  You've got to get this magic band to the others.... my wounds are too great for me to travel much longer...
Take this... Obtain the gems from the local orc officers... Socket that band with them and then take it to the Freep...

npcs.name: Yrrey Burbridge
utterances: I'm not looking to hire any more hands, if that's what you're asking.
What?! Oh, my Ethernaut charms! I thought I'd never see this again.
But you didn't find the Roadyle Yerethe Tol charm?
Fitting to have lost that one, isn't it? Thank you for returning this. It means a great deal to me.

npcs.name: Zaikik
utterances: The kerrans don't like us here, but we were here first! I'm not leaving.

npcs.name: ZaZa Lenska
utterances: Have you seen my husband, Valeri?  He leaves home too often. He comes and goes as he pleases, and I never know where he is! I've had other husbands, and I know the signs of a cheater.
He's tall and slim with jet black fur and three hoops in his left ear. He's handsome, oh, so handsome!  Surely you could not have missed him!  Unless, perhaps, his visits are in a ... private home.

Oh, to think of Valeri--my sweet, precious husband--in the arms of another!  No!  I cannot bear it!  I must know the truth!  And I know just the way.  Mama's potion will show me whether he's faithful to his ZaZa, or not.  Can you help this poor, unhappy wife?

I need ingredients for my potion.  Not too many and they must be fresh. I need to spread this potion on my Valeri's clothes ... and then I will have the answers I need.  Let me write this down for you; it's complex.
I'm trusting you with the happiness of my marriage.  You are most kind to help poor ZaZa.  I will see you again ... soon.
